intro: Oenothera avita subsp. arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are hairy to the touch. Oenothera avita subsp. arizonica is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species.
